intro: Phagnalon retecta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved phagnalon, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. Native to regions of Europe and western Asia, it thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. The plant has a compact growth habit and is often found in disturbed or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of certain ecological systems.
